info.title: Haiilo Plug-in life cycle events webhook API
info.description: A plug-in needs to implement this API to be able to receive life cycle events

post.description: This event is sent when a Haiilo admin wants to install the plug-in

token.description: An encoded JWT token [RFC 7519] where the payload holds the event data. The token is signed.

header.description: JWT header (JOSE compliant, see RFC 7515 section 4)

jku.description: Link to public key that SHOULD be used to verify the token signature. The plug-in MUST verify that the URL leads to a trusted source.

iss.description: The URL of the Haiilo tenant

iat.description: Event creation time as a 'seconds since epoch' timestamp [RFC 3339]

exp.description: The token expiration time as a 'seconds since epoch' timestamp [RFC 3339]

tenantId.description: The ID of the Haiilo tenant

pluginId.description: The plug-in installation id. The plug-in should use a combination of the installation id and the tenantId or issuer url as a unique id to identify the installation.

sub.description: Event action id, always 'install' for an install event

certificate.description: The certificate that is used to sign the JWT token and all following data tokens. The format is a one-liner PEM without the boundaries. As of version 1.1.0 this field is marked as deprecated and will be removed with the next major update. Instead the certificate information in the header MUST be used.

400.description: The plug-in encountered an error while installing.

post.description: This event will be sent after installation if the manifest requested to receive a Haiilo API access token

token.description: An encoded JWT token [RFC 7519] where the payload holds the event data. The token is signed.

header.description: JWT header (JOSE compliant, see RFC 7515 section 4)

jku.description: Link to public key that SHOULD be used to verify the token signature. The plug-in MUST verify that the URL leads to a trusted source.

iss.description: The URL of the Haiilo tenant

iat.description: Event creation time as a 'seconds since epoch' timestamp [RFC 3339]

exp.description: The token expiration time as a 'seconds since epoch' timestamp [RFC 3339]

tenantId.description: The ID of the Haiilo tenant

pluginId.description: The plug-in installation id. The plug-in should use a combination of the installation id and the tenantId or issuer url as a unique id to identify the installation.

sub.description: Event action id, always 'access_token' for an access token event

base_url.description: The base URL for all URLs contained within this token and for requests to the Haiilo backend (not including the OAuth 2 context path '/api')

client.description: Information about how to obtain a client-based access token via the queried grant flow

token_endpoint_url.description: The OAuth 2.0 token endpoint where to redeem the authorization code for an API access token, relative to the base URL

trigger_event.description: Information about how to re-trigger an access token event when the token expired

url.description: The URL, relative to the base URL

body.description: If existing this request payload must be sent with the request as MIME type 'application/json'

201.description: The plug-in accepts the authentication token

400.description: The plug-in encountered an error while processing the authentication token.
